edu.calpoly.spritely

Class SolidColorTile

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.calpoly.spritely.SolidColorTile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tile

    public class SolidColorTile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tile
    A tile that is represented graphically as a solid color. The color may be semi-transparent. SolidColorTile instance are immutable.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SolidColorTile(java.awt.Color color, char text)
      Create a SolidColorTile with the given color, and that is represented by the given character when in text mode.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gives the text representation of this tile.

      Paints this tile into the given graphics context g.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SolidColorTile

        public SolidColorTile(java.awt.Color color,
                      char text)
        Create a SolidColorTile with the given color, and that is represented by the given character when in text mode. The color may be semi-transparent.
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the tile
        text - The character representation of this tile in text mode

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                  Size size)
        Description copied from interface: Tile
        Paints this tile into the given graphics context g. g will be set up so that tiles that are underneath this tile will show through if this tile has transparent, or semi-transparent pixels.

        Note that Spritely optimizes repainting. It will only paint a frame if it needs to, because a different set of tiles is on a given square. See the documentation about immutability at the beginning of this class.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface Tile
        Parameters:
        g - The Java graphics context to draw into, with an appropriate translation and crop already set.
        size - The size of this tile. For a given window, the value of size will never change.
        See Also:
        AlphaComposite.SrcOver

      • getText

        public char getText()
        Description copied from interface: Tile
        Gives the text representation of this tile.

        the character representation of this tile in text mode.
